events.body:
Don't think this needs to be two commits.

On Monday, November 16, 2015, MarcoFalke notifications@github.com wrote:

> ---
> 
> You can view, comment on, or merge this pull request online at:
> 
>   https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7028
> Commit Summary
> - [qa] Move README.md to /qa
> - [qa] Update README.md with new -help message
> 
> File Changes
> - _A_ qa/README.md
>   https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7028/files#diff-0 (158)
> - _M_ qa/rpc-tests/README.md
>   https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7028/files#diff-1 (157)
> 
> Patch Links:
> - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7028.patch
> - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7028.diff
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7028.

Is it better to move this? Looks like everything relates to the things below `qa/rpc-tests`. 

I'd prefer adding a more concise README.md in `qa` that describes the different directories in there.

events.message:
[qa] Split README.md to /qa and /qa/rpc-tests

+ Update with new -help message
